greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of normal sequences of length n whose standard factorization into Lyndon words (aperiodic necklaces) has k factors.
comment: A finite sequence is normal if its union is an initial interval of positive integers.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Rows n = 1..50 of triangle, flattened
program: EulerMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=x*Ser(u), vars=variables(p)); Vec(exp( sum(i=1, n, substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i,vars))/i ))-1)}
A(n)={[Vecrev(p/y) | p<-sum(k=1, n, EulerMT(vector(n, n, y*U(n,k)))*sum(j=k, n, (-1)^(k-j)*binomial(j,k)))]}
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 11 2017
ext: Example and program corrected by _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 08 2018
